responsibilities: Develop and deploy machine learning solutions to enhance customer personalization, optimize monetization models, and improve lead quality.
Build scalable ML solutions that contribute to measurable improvements in company performance metrics within the first 12 months.
Collaborate with Product, Engineering, Business Intelligence, and other teams to integrate ML models into initiatives across various verticals.
Identify and prioritize high-impact ML opportunities, leading their design, implementation, and deployment.
Mentor junior data scientists and contribute to the growth of the data science team.
Create containerized ML models using Docker/Kubernetes to ensure efficiency, scalability, and ease of deployment.
qualifications: Experience with Data Science tools like Git, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Hands-on experience in cloud services like AWS or GCP.
Analytical excellence and a proven track record of leveraging ML models to drive performance metrics.
Curiosity and innovation in learning and staying updated with the latest ML/AI trends and technologies.
Leadership skills to independently own projects and collaborate effectively across teams.
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on developing and deploying machine learning (ML) solutions for customer personalization, monetization optimization, and lead quality improvement. It involves building scalable ML solutions, integrating ML models into various initiatives, and mentoring junior data scientists. The skills required include proficiency in Python and SQL, experience with data science tools like Git, Docker, and Kubernetes, and hands-on experience with cloud services like AWS or GCP. The job also emphasizes analytical excellence and staying updated with the latest ML/AI trends.

While the job clearly involves machine learning and data science, there is no specific mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The focus is more on general ML solutions and their integration into business processes rather than on developing or deploying GenAI or LLMs. The skills and responsibilities do not explicitly indicate the use of GenAI or LLMs, which are typically associated with tasks like natural language processing, text generation, or conversational AI.

Therefore, based on the provided responsibilities and skills, it does not appear that the job specifically involves working with Generative AI or language models.
